author: jstrachan
msg: Applied Jeffrey D. Brekke's patch that fixes the bootstrap process on unix and removes the cygwin crap thats not really needed for windows users anyways.

author: jstrachan
msg: Patched Maven so that it now depends on version 2.0.3 of xml-apis.jar.
xml-apis.jar comes from Xalan distributions and it should contain all of SAX + DOM + JAXP.
up until now we've been using an incorrect version of xml-apis.jar which does not come with all of JAXP.
If ever you want to use SAX + DOM + part of JAXP, then use xmlParserAPIs.jar from Xerces. Confusing eh?
However using half-of-JAXP seems just silly when the XSLT half of JAXP is quite small, so in the long run it'll probably save us some classpath issues by just using the complete, xml-apis.jar.
